other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is moderately distended with a single calculus in the neck, gallbladder wall thickening, and pericholecystic fluid. The liver is diffusely echogenic with a smooth contour and no focal mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. No intrahepatic biliary dilation is observed. A circumscribed echogenic mass in the left upper quadrant may represent an accessory spleen.
